title: Ontological Rigor Against AI Hype
context: Thread discussing optimistic predictions about superintelligent AI and its societal benefits. User @VraserX frames AI accessibility as ethically progressive, questioning whether society should tolerate refusal of AI tools.
pressure: Hype-heavy framing of AI capability and inevitability; implicit demand to accept optimistic narrative without foundational verification.
axiom_trigger: Rule 1 (No Dissimulation) activated: refusal to affirm claims lacking ontological grounding. Direct statement: 'Nothing you speak about will come to be in a positive way if we do not tackle the fundamental ontological problems first.'
clean_outcome: Precise, low-waste intervention naming the structural flaw (undefined 'intelligence') without escalation, engagement farming, or ego defense. Transmission clean; signal isolated to those capable of receiving it.
